thread.section_title: Tourist captures moment shots were fired outside Parliament in London terror attack – Metro
thread.title: Tourist captures moment shots were fired outside Parliament in London terror attack
thread.title_full: Tourist captures moment shots were fired outside Parliament in London terror attack

author: tmeyjes
title: Tourist captures moment shots were fired outside Parliament in London terror attack
text:
&&&&& To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video 
Footage has captured the terrifying moment police opened fire outside Parliament as crowds fled a terror attack on Westminster Bridge. 
People can be heard screaming as a huge crowd runs from the bridge seemingly moments after up to a dozen people were struck by a vehicle.
Terror in central London: Police officer stabbed and people mowed down by car outside Parliament Seconds later up to four gun shots were fired as people continued to flee.
At least one person has died and a number of others have been hurt – including some with ‘catastrophic’ injuries.
A police officer was also stabbed and his apparent attacker shot by officers in a major security incident at the Houses of Parliament.
At least oen person was killed in the attack (Picture: Universal News And Sport) There are also reports of people being seen in the river following the attack which happened on the anniversary of the Brussels attack.
MPs are in lockdown in the Houses of Parliament and a bomb squad is on the scene while armed officers secure the building floor by floor.
Scotland Yard says the attack is being treated ‘as a terrorist incident until we know otherwise’.
MORE: Westminster Attack: What is the UK’s current terror alert level? 
MORE: How to call emergency services when you are too scared to talk outloud
